cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 530 miles ESE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the north-western Gulf of Mexico toward the central Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the middle Texas coast (between Corpus Christi and Port O'Connor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Mansfield to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Much of the Texas coastline from the lower coast near Port Mansfield northward through Galveston Bay
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (guidance typically 2–4 ft for a weak tropical storm along this stretch of coast)
weather_observation.wind: Low (10%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds, gusts could reach 45 mph if the system strengthens before landfall
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor to moderate surge of 2–4 ft possible along the middle Texas coast including Corpus Christi Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: Widespread 2–4 inches with isolated totals near 6 inches expected in the Corpus Christi area
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents beginning late Friday
